name: SupportMoulderAndColm
_source: speak;Moulder;Colm, you dolt!|Don't you see what you've done!?
speak;Colm;Hey!|That's no way to be!|I was trying to do you a favor here.|It's not my fault if I accidentally burned your package lighting my torch!
speak;Moulder;That's exactly what I'm talking about!|You're always so careless!|My spare robes were in that bundle!|Oh, and now look at them!|They've been charred black!
speak;Colm;Oops...|Those were your clothes?|Tch!|That IS a shame.|My mistake.|I apologize.
speak;Moulder;This isn't the first time this has happened, Colm!|And it was my robes of office then, too!|I'm starting to wonder if you have it in for my clothes!
speak;Colm;Oh, no, no.|Don't be silly!|And besides, only the bottom has been singed.|Just trim it off and wear it short.|See?|Why, I'm sure you'll set the world of fashion on fire with your new look!
speak;Moulder;That's what you said last time about the sleeves.
speak;Colm;Oh, er...|Really?|Ha ha ha!|Well, sorry.|I'm sorry.|No, really.|I deeply regret this.
speak;Moulder;You don't look particularly sorry.|You look rather pleased with yourself.
speak;Moulder;If that's the case, then you can just spend tonight reflecting upon what you've done.
speak;Moulder;I want you to take some time to reflect on the consequences of your actions.|Colm, I'm only doing this because I care.|I care about the condition of your soul.
speak;Colm;...You really know how to lay on a guilt trip, don't you?|Sigh. I'm in trouble now...|Shoot!
speak;Moulder;Colm.|Did you do what I asked of you?
speak;Colm;Of course, Father Moulder!|In fact, I've set aside a little time each night to reflect on my day's deeds!
speak;Moulder;Good.|I'm glad to hear you've taken my suggestion to heart.|Might I inquire as to what manner of thing you're reflecting on?
speak;Colm;Well, I reflected on how hungry I was, and so I packed some extra salted pork today.
speak;Colm;Yes.|See, on reflection, it had been a while since I'd had salted pork.
speak;Colm;Hm...|The day before...|Oh, yeah!|I was reflecting on how much walking we'd done, and I realized I needed new shoes.|I figured, next chance I get, I'd go out and steal me a new pair!
speak;Moulder;Colm...|I'm not sure you understand what it is I asked you to reflect upon.
speak;Colm;You told me to think about what I'd done during the day and to reflect on it.

speak;Moulder;I told you to think over the things you did and feel sorry for having done.|I wasn't talking about what you wanted to eat or whether you needed new shoes!|That is not the point of all this!
speak;Colm;Did it ever cross your mind that...|maybe I haven't done anything I'm sorry about?

speak;Moulder;Don't be foolish!|Think back on the things you've done during the day.|Then, think about the troubles you caused and vow not to repeat them!|Do you understand me now?|This is for your own sake!|I'll come back in a few days.|Keep thinking!
speak;Colm;...I thought that whole self-reflection thing was going a little too well.|Fine, Father.|I'll do it. I'll do it.
speak;Colm;Oh. Let me guess.|You want to hear what I've been reflecting on.
speak;Moulder;Exactly.|Although...I noticed that you look sleepy.|Are you well?
speak;Colm;I...was up late last night thinking about everything.|I couldn't sleep well.
speak;Moulder;That's unfortunate.|Did you have so much that you regretted doing?|Hm.|Well, let me hear it.|Tell me what's on your mind.
speak;Colm;How's that?|I'm doing good, aren't I?
speak;Moulder;I'd say so.|You're going over your every action, from waking to sleep.
speak;Colm;Well, that's what you told me to do.
speak;Moulder;Well done, my lad!|I've never heard so much thought go into what you've done before!|Compared with the salted pork, your transformation is impressive!|It's a little extreme, but......

speak;Colm;But the funny thing is...|I've started noticing all these things about me I didn't know before.|I keep saying, “That was wrong” and “I'll do better next time.”|So...I'm not repeating the same mistakes over and over.

speak;Moulder;I had noticed that your behavior has significantly improved of late.|You look sleepy now, but your face seems far more peaceful as well.|It seems that you're finally growing up, thanks to these quiet moments.
speak;Colm;Heh...|You know, I think that's the first nice thing you've said to me!
speak;Moulder;You're coming along just fine.|But...|go easy on yourself, all right?

speak;Moulder;If you stay up all night thinking about your day, you'll make yourself sick.|You've already mastered the art of learning from your own experiences.|I don't want you falling into old habits because of a little illness.|I have high expectations of you, my son.
speak;Colm;Thank you, Father Moulder.|I'm glad that you do.|It's only your expectations that have made me become a better man.
